customer-page-header.description: Customers can be used to manage the clients of your company. You can add, edit, and delete customers as needed. But the must important usage of customers is to create sales with the VAT return support. Only registered customers can be used in sales.
customer-page-header.title: Customers

data-entry-page-header.description: Data entries represent instances of data type structures. Each data entry is associated with a specific data type and contains values for each field defined in that data type. You can create, edit, and delete data entries as needed.
data-entry-page-header.title: Data Entries

data-type-page-header.description: Data types are used to define the structure of data entries. Each data type can have multiple fields, and each field can have different types of data, including relationships between different data types, allowing you to create complex data models that reflect your business needs. You can create, edit, and delete data types as needed.
data-type-page-header.title: Data Types

failed-to-load.description: The data you are trying to access failed to load, if this is a temporary issue, you can try reloading the page.
failed-to-load.title: Failed to load

import-configuration-page-header.description: Import configurations are used to define how specific data types can be imported into the system via files. You can create, edit, and delete import configurations as needed.
import-configuration-page-header.title: Import Configurations

instance-page-header.description: By using instances you can work within different workspaces. Each instance has its own set of users, settings and data. You can create, edit or delete instances as you need.
instance-page-header.title: Instances

profile-change-password.description: Form to change your current password. If forgotten, use password reset within Login page.
profile-change-password.title: Password

profile-management.description: Details of your profile. Unfortunately, your email cannot be changed. To change it contact the support.
profile-management.title: Details

report-template-page-header.description: In case you need to export data from your instance, you can create a report template that will allow you to export specific data type entries. You can create as many report templates as you need.
report-template-page-header.title: Report Templates

reset-password.description: Please provide your email address to reset your password. Request will be sent to your email which will last for 10 minutes.

sale-page-header.description: Sales are transactions of goods being sold to customers. These sales can be submitted for VAT returns. You can create, edit, and delete sales as needed.
sale-page-header.title: Sales

salesman-page-header.description: Salesmen are individuals responsible for selling products or services. They can be associated with specific sales and customers. You can create, edit, and delete salesman as needed.
salesman-page-header.title: Salesmen

These are your sessions (times and devices you logged in with).

If you want to revoke a session, click on the revoke button. Current session cannot be revoked.
session-showcase.title: Sessions

user-page-header.description: Manage application's users. It includes their details, but not passwords.
user-page-header.title: Users

home.description: Bapsk is a simple yet useful tool for managing your business's accounting and finances needs. You can easily track your business data, generate reports and submit VAT returns for your foreign customers. Want to know more? Let's get started!

0.question: What is the purpose of this application?
0.answer: This application is designed to help you manage your business data in a simple and effective way. It may look that this is Notepad or TODO application alternative, but no. This application is designed to be more than just a notepad. It provides a structured way to manage your business data, allowing you to define custom data types, import data from files, generate reports and submit VAT returns.

1.question: How do I create a new workspace instance?
1.answer: You can create a new workspace instance by going into Instances and clicking on the "Create Instance" button.

2.question: Can I invite my team members to collaborate?
2.answer: Yes, you can invite your team members by going to your created workspace instance, editing it and sending them an invitation by email.

3.question: How do I define my data structure?
3.answer: You can define your data structure by creating custom data types in the "Data Types" section within your workspace.

4.question: How do I import data from files?
4.answer: You can import data from files by defining an import configuration in the "Import Configurations" section and then using it to import data from CSV files within specific Data Entry sections.

5.question: How do I generate reports?
5.answer: You can generate reports by setting up a report template in the "Report Templates" section and then using it within Generate Report section to generate reports based on your data entries.

6.question: How do I submit VAT returns?
6.answer: It is only possible by using the predefined data structures of customers, salesmen and sales. You have to create sale entries and then submit them for VAT returns. VAT return is explicitly integrated into Lithuanian tax system. So, it is only available for Lithuania's salesmen.

7.question: Is there a limit to the number of entries I can create?
7.answer: No, there is no limit to the number of entries you can create in your workspace instance.

8.question: Isn't it too much to manage all these steps?
8.answer: At first glance, it may seem overwhelming, but once you get the hang of it, it becomes a simple and effective process. Each step is quite straightforward.

faq.description: Find answers to common questions about using Bapsk.
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions

0.title: Create your Workspace Instance
0.description: This is where you will manage your business data.

2.description: Define the structure of your data by creating custom data types.

3.title: Create Data Entries
3.description: Start adding data to your instance by creating entries.

4.title: Define Import Configuration
4.description: To import entries from files in defined CSV formats.

5.title: Setup Report Template
5.description: To visualize your data type entries on a printable report.

6.title: Import External Data
6.description: Use the import configuration to import data from files.

7.title: Create Occurred Sales
7.description: Create sale entries to be used for VAT returns.

8.title: Submit VAT Return
8.description: Submit sale TaxFree declaration for the customer to get the VAT return.

9.title: Generate Report
9.description: Generate and export reports based on your data.
